017package org.parboiled.common;
018
019import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.*;
020import org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException;
021
022import java.lang.reflect.*;
023import java.util.*;
024
025/**
026 * General utility methods.
027 */
028public final class Utils {
029
030    public static final Character[] EMPTY_CHARACTER_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Character[0];
031    public static final Integer[] EMPTY_INTEGER_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Integer[0];
032    public static final Long[] EMPTY_LONG_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Long[0];
033    public static final Short[] EMPTY_SHORT_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Short[0];
034    public static final Byte[] EMPTY_BYTE_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Byte[0];
035    public static final Float[] EMPTY_FLOAT_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Float[0];
036    public static final Double[] EMPTY_DOUBLE_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Double[0];
037    public static final Boolean[] EMPTY_BOOLEAN_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Boolean[0];
038
039
040    private Utils() {}
041
042    public static Character[] toObjectArray(char[] array) {
043        if (array == null) return null;
044        if (array.length == 0) return EMPTY_CHARACTER_OBJECT_ARRAY;
045        Character[] result = new Character[array.length];
046        for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) result[i] = array[i];
047        return result;
048    }
049
050    public static Integer[] toObjectArray(int[] array) {
051        if (array == null) return null;
052        if (array.length == 0) return EMPTY_INTEGER_OBJECT_ARRAY;
053        Integer[] result = new Integer[array.length];
054        for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) result[i] = array[i];
055        return result;
056    }
057
058    public static Long[] toObjectArray(long[] array) {
059        if (array == null) return null;
060        if (array.length == 0) return EMPTY_LONG_OBJECT_ARRAY;
061        Long[] result = new Long[array.length];
062        for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) result[i] = array[i];
063        return result;
064    }
065
066    public static Short[] toObjectArray(short[] array) {
067        if (array == null) return null;
068        if (array.length == 0) return EMPTY_SHORT_OBJECT_ARRAY;
069        Short[] result = new Short[array.length];
070        for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) result[i] = array[i];
071        return result;
072    }
073
074    public static Byte[] toObjectArray(byte[] array) {
075        if (array == null) return null;
076        if (array.length == 0) return EMPTY_BYTE_OBJECT_ARRAY;
077        Byte[] result = new Byte[array.length];
078        for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) result[i] = array[i];
079        return result;
080    }
081
082    public static Float[] toObjectArray(float[] array) {
083        if (array == null) return null;
084        if (array.length == 0) return EMPTY_FLOAT_OBJECT_ARRAY;
085        Float[] result = new Float[array.length];
086        for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) result[i] = array[i];
087        return result;
088    }
089
090    public static Double[] toObjectArray(double[] array) {
091        if (array == null) return null;
092        if (array.length == 0) return EMPTY_DOUBLE_OBJECT_ARRAY;
093        Double[] result = new Double[array.length];
094        for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) result[i] = array[i];
095        return result;
096    }
097
098    public static Boolean[] toObjectArray(boolean[] array) {
099        if (array == null) return null;
100        if (array.length == 0) return EMPTY_BOOLEAN_OBJECT_ARRAY;
101        Boolean[] result = new Boolean[array.length];
102        for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) result[i] = array[i];
103        return result;
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Joins the given arguments into one array.
108     *
109     * @param firstElement the first element
110     * @param moreElements more elements (optional)
111     * @return a new array containing all arguments.
112     */
113    @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
114    public static <T> T[] arrayOf(T firstElement, T... moreElements) {
115        checkArgNotNull(moreElements, "moreElements");
116        Class elementType = moreElements.getClass().getComponentType();
117        T[] array = (T[]) Array.newInstance(elementType, moreElements.length + 1);
118        array[0] = firstElement;
119        System.arraycopy(moreElements, 0, array, 1, moreElements.length);
120        return array;
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Joins the given arguments into one array.
125     *
126     * @param firstElement the first element
127     * @param secondElement the second element
128     * @param moreElements more elements (optional)
129     * @return a new array containing all arguments.
130     */
131    @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
132    public static <T> T[] arrayOf(T firstElement, T secondElement, T... moreElements) {
133        checkArgNotNull(moreElements, "moreElements");
134        Class elementType = moreElements.getClass().getComponentType();
135        T[] array = (T[]) Array.newInstance(elementType, moreElements.length + 2);
136        array[0] = firstElement;
137        array[1] = secondElement;
138        System.arraycopy(moreElements, 0, array, 2, moreElements.length);
139        return array;
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Joins the given arguments into one array.
144     *
145     * @param firstElements the first elements
146     * @param lastElement   the element to append
147     * @return a new array containing all arguments.
148     */
149    @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
150    public static <T> T[] arrayOf(T[] firstElements, T lastElement) {
151        checkArgNotNull(firstElements, "firstElements");
152        Class elementType = firstElements.getClass().getComponentType();
153        T[] array = (T[]) Array.newInstance(elementType, firstElements.length + 1);
154        System.arraycopy(firstElements, 0, array, 0, firstElements.length);
155        array[firstElements.length] = lastElement;
156        return array;
157    }
158
159    /**
160     * Null enabled toString().
161     *
162     * @param obj the object
163     * @return the empty string of obj is null, otherwise obj.toString()
164     */
165    public static String toString(Object obj) {
166        return obj == null ? "" : obj.toString();
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Null enabled equals().
171     *
172     * @param a the first object
173     * @param b the second object
174     * @return true if both are null or both are equal
175     */
176    public static <T> boolean equal(T a, T b) {
177        return a != null ? a.equals(b) : b == null;
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Gets the actual type arguments that are used in a given implementation of a given generic base class or interface.
182     * (Based on code copyright 2007 by Ian Robertson).
183     *
184     * @param base           the generic base class or interface
185     * @param implementation the type (potentially) implementing the given base class or interface
186     * @return a list of the raw classes for the actual type arguments.
187     */
188    public static List<Class<?>> getTypeArguments(Class<?> base, Class<?> implementation) {
189        checkArgNotNull(base, "base");
190        checkArgNotNull(implementation, "implementation");
191        Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes = new HashMap<Type, Type>();
192
193        // first we need to resolve all supertypes up to the required base class or interface
194        // and find the right Type for it
195        Type type;
196
197        Queue<Type> toCheck = new LinkedList<Type>();
198        toCheck.add(implementation);
199        while (true) {
200            // if we have checked everything and not found the base class we return an empty list
201            if (toCheck.isEmpty()) return ImmutableList.of();
202
203            type = toCheck.remove();
204            Class<?> clazz;
205
206            if (type instanceof Class) {
207                // there is no useful information for us in raw types, so just keep going up the inheritance chain
208                clazz = (Class) type;
209                if (base.isInterface()) {
210                    // if we are actually looking for the type parameters to an interface we also need to
211                    // look at all the ones implemented by the given current one
212                    toCheck.addAll(Arrays.asList(clazz.getGenericInterfaces()));
213                }
214            } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType) {
215                ParameterizedType parameterizedType = (ParameterizedType) type;
216                clazz = (Class) parameterizedType.getRawType();
217
218                // for instances of ParameterizedType we extract and remember all type arguments
219                TypeVariable<?>[] typeParameters = clazz.getTypeParameters();
220                Type[] actualTypeArguments = parameterizedType.getActualTypeArguments();
221                for (int i = 0; i < actualTypeArguments.length; i++) {
222                    resolvedTypes.put(typeParameters[i], actualTypeArguments[i]);
223                }
224            } else {
225                return ImmutableList.of();
226            }
227
228            // we can stop if we have reached the sought for base type
229            if (base.equals(getClass(type))) break;
230
231            toCheck.add(clazz.getGenericSuperclass());
232        }
233
234        // finally, for each actual type argument provided to baseClass,
235        // determine (if possible) the raw class for that type argument.
236        Type[] actualTypeArguments;
237        if (type instanceof Class) {
238            actualTypeArguments = ((Class) type).getTypeParameters();
239        } else {
240            actualTypeArguments = ((ParameterizedType) type).getActualTypeArguments();
241        }
242        List<Class<?>> typeArgumentsAsClasses = new ArrayList<Class<?>>();
243        // resolve types by chasing down type variables.
244        for (Type baseType : actualTypeArguments) {
245            while (resolvedTypes.containsKey(baseType)) {
246                baseType = resolvedTypes.get(baseType);
247            }
248            typeArgumentsAsClasses.add(getClass(baseType));
249        }
250        return typeArgumentsAsClasses;
251    }
252
253    /**
254     * Get the underlying class for a type, or null if the type is a variable type.
255     * (Copyright 2007 by Ian Robertson).
256     *
257     * @param type the type
258     * @return the underlying class
259     */
260
261    public static Class<?> getClass(Type type) {
262        if (type instanceof Class) {
263            return (Class<?>) type;
264        } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType) {
265            return getClass(((ParameterizedType) type).getRawType());
266        } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType) {
267            Type componentType = ((GenericArrayType) type).getGenericComponentType();
268            Class<?> componentClass = getClass(componentType);
269            if (componentClass != null) {
270                return Array.newInstance(componentClass, 0).getClass();
271            }
272        }
273        return null;
274    }
275
276    /**
277     * Determines if the primitive type is boxed as the boxed type
278     * @param primitive the primitive type to check if boxed is the boxed type
279     * @param boxed the possible boxed type of the primitive
280     * @return true if boxed is the boxed type of primitive, false otherwise.
281     */
282    public static boolean isBoxedType(Class<?> primitive, Class<?> boxed) {
283        return (primitive.equals(boolean.class) && boxed.equals(Boolean.class)) ||
284               (primitive.equals(byte.class) && boxed.equals(Byte.class)) ||
285               (primitive.equals(char.class) && boxed.equals(Character.class)) ||
286               (primitive.equals(double.class) && boxed.equals(Double.class)) ||
287               (primitive.equals(float.class) && boxed.equals(Float.class)) ||
288               (primitive.equals(int.class) && boxed.equals(Integer.class)) ||
289               (primitive.equals(long.class) && boxed.equals(Long.class)) ||
290               (primitive.equals(short.class) && boxed.equals(Short.class)) ||
291               (primitive.equals(void.class) && boxed.equals(Void.class));
292    }
293
294    /**
295     * Finds the constructor of the given class that is compatible with the given arguments.
296     *
297     * @param type the class to find the constructor of
298     * @param args the arguments
299     * @return the constructor
300     */
301    public static Constructor findConstructor(Class<?> type, Object[] args) {
302        outer:
303        for (Constructor constructor : type.getConstructors()) {
304            Class<?>[] paramTypes = constructor.getParameterTypes();
305            if (paramTypes.length != args.length) continue;
306            for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
307                Object arg = args[i];
308                if (arg != null && !paramTypes[i].isAssignableFrom(arg.getClass()) && !isBoxedType(paramTypes[i], arg.getClass())) continue outer;
309                if (arg == null && paramTypes[i].isPrimitive()) continue outer;
310            }
311            return constructor;
312        }
313        throw new GrammarException("No constructor found for %s and the given %s arguments", type, args.length);
314    }
315
316    /**
317     * Formats the given long value into a human readable notation using the Kilo, Mega, Giga, etc. abbreviations.
318     *
319     * @param value the value to format
320     * @return the string representation
321     */
322    public static String humanize(long value) {
323        if (value < 0) {
324            return '-' + humanize(-value);
325        } else if (value > 1000000000000000000L) {
326            return Double.toString(
327                    (value + 500000000000000L) / 1000000000000000L * 1000000000000000L / 1000000000000000000.0) + 'E';
328        } else if (value > 100000000000000000L) {
329            return Double.toString(
330                    (value + 50000000000000L) / 100000000000000L * 100000000000000L / 1000000000000000.0) + 'P';
331        } else if (value > 10000000000000000L) {
332            return Double
333                    .toString((value + 5000000000000L) / 10000000000000L * 10000000000000L / 1000000000000000.0) + 'P';
334        } else if (value > 1000000000000000L) {
335            return Double
336                    .toString((value + 500000000000L) / 1000000000000L * 1000000000000L / 1000000000000000.0) + 'P';
337        } else if (value > 100000000000000L) {
338            return Double.toString((value + 50000000000L) / 100000000000L * 100000000000L / 1000000000000.0) + 'T';
339        } else if (value > 10000000000000L) {
340            return Double.toString((value + 5000000000L) / 10000000000L * 10000000000L / 1000000000000.0) + 'T';
341        } else if (value > 1000000000000L) {
342            return Double.toString((value + 500000000) / 1000000000 * 1000000000 / 1000000000000.0) + 'T';
343        } else if (value > 100000000000L) {
344            return Double.toString((value + 50000000) / 100000000 * 100000000 / 1000000000.0) + 'G';
345        } else if (value > 10000000000L) {
346            return Double.toString((value + 5000000) / 10000000 * 10000000 / 1000000000.0) + 'G';
347        } else if (value > 1000000000) {
348            return Double.toString((value + 500000) / 1000000 * 1000000 / 1000000000.0) + 'G';
349        } else if (value > 100000000) {
350            return Double.toString((value + 50000) / 100000 * 100000 / 1000000.0) + 'M';
351        } else if (value > 10000000) {
352            return Double.toString((value + 5000) / 10000 * 10000 / 1000000.0) + 'M';
353        } else if (value > 1000000) {
354            return Double.toString((value + 500) / 1000 * 1000 / 1000000.0) + 'M';
355        } else if (value > 100000) {
356            return Double.toString((value + 50) / 100 * 100 / 1000.0) + 'K';
357        } else if (value > 10000) {
358            return Double.toString((value + 5) / 10 * 10 / 1000.0) + 'K';
359        } else if (value > 1000) {
360            return Double.toString(value / 1000.0) + 'K';
361        } else {
362            return Long.toString(value) + ' ';
363        }
364    }
365}
366
